description:
A wacky comedy about identical sextuplets causing wild pranks. Each episode features 2 stories.

Note: The original 1966 broadcast of Osomatsu-kun ran over 60 time slots. Four of these were entirely rerun content, while eight others featured one new half-episode and one rerun.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Achromatic
tags.description: Contains animation that is primarily done in black and white.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

node.description: **Fujio Akatsuka** was a pioneer Japanese artist of comical manga known as the "Gag Manga King".

[Website](https://www.maocloud.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MaoCloud) |  [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/maomaowsan/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/MaoCloud)

Multi-talented freelance artist who specialized in depicting nature, such as clouds and waves.

After graduating from high school, he joined [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/), and worked under [Keiichirou Kimura](https://anilist.co/staff/168326/). Later joined Madhouse and was one of the studio's leading animators during its early days together with [Akio Sugino](https://anilist.co/staff/103064/) and [Yoshiaki Kawajiri](https://anilist.co/staff/100812/).

Born in 1898, Chiba. Yamamoto began producing animations after being invited by [Seitarou Kitayama](https://anilist.co/staff/116981/). Before the war, he created many works commissioned by government offices. After the war, as many artists of his generation left animation, Yamamoto spent his life supporting the industry with Toei Doga.

(Source: https://animation.filmarchives.jp/en/writer24.html)
**Fujio Akatsuka** was a pioneer Japanese artist of comical manga known as the "Gag Manga King".
**Fujio Akatsuka** was a pioneer Japanese artist of comical manga known as the "Gag Manga King".
__Young Fresh__ is a Japanese Chorus Group who lend their voices to a lot of anime related songs.
Tagami Kazue is a Japanese voice actress

[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Midori_Katō) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/加藤みどり)

Midori Katou is a Japanese actress and narrator who is most famous for the role of Sazae Fuguta from the long-running family anime Sazae-san. She is also known for voicing Yoshiko in Sally the Witch and Osomatsu Matsuno in Osomatsu-kun (1966).

On October 6, 2019, she received the Guinness World Record for *"the longest career as a voice actor for the same character in an animated television series"* for voicing Sazae, which she shares with [Takako Sasuga](https://anilist.co/staff/104803) the voice of Tarao from the same show.
Urato Watanabe was a composer from Aomori Prefecture, Japan.

title.native: ひみつのアッコちゃん
